description:
Thorfinn is son to one of the Vikings' greatest warriors, but when his father is killed in battle by the mercenary leader Askeladd, he swears to have his revenge. Thorfinn joins Askeladd's band in order to challenge him to a duel, and ends up caught in the middle of a war for the crown of England.

(Source: Kodansha USA)
synonyms: สงครามคนทมิฬ

tags.name: Vikings
tags.description: Prominently features Scandinavian seafaring pirates and warriors.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Foreign
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a country outside the country of origin.

tags.name: Historical
tags.description: Partly or completely set during a real period of world history.

tags.name: War
tags.description: Partly or completely set during wartime.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Seinen
tags.description: Target demographic is adult males.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Military
tags.description: Centered around the life and activities of military personnel.

tags.name: Politics
tags.description: Centers around politics, politicians, or government activities.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Travel
tags.description: Centers around character(s) moving between places a significant distance apart.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Medieval
tags.description: Partially or completely set in the Middle Ages or a Middle Ages-inspired setting. Commonly features elements such as European castles and knights.

tags.name: Survival
tags.description: Centers around the struggle to live in spite of extreme obstacles.

tags.name: Ships
tags.description: Prominently features the use of sea-based transportation vessels.

tags.name: Conspiracy
tags.description: Contains one or more factions controlling or attempting to control the world from the shadows.

tags.name: Slavery
tags.description: Prominently features slaves, slavery, or slave trade.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

tags.name: Orphan
tags.description: Prominently features a character that is an orphan.

tags.name: Pirates
tags.description: Prominently features sea-faring adventurers branded as criminals by the law.

tags.name: Language Barrier
tags.description: A barrier to communication between people who are unable to speak a common language.

tags.name: Religion
tags.description: Centers on the belief that humanity is related to supernatural, transcendental, and spiritual elements.

tags.name: Snowscape
tags.description: Prominently or partially set in a snowy environment.

tags.name: Spearplay

tags.name: CGI

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Cult
tags.description: Features a social group with unorthodox religious, spiritual, or philosophical beliefs and practices.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/makotoyukimura)

Before writing his own manga he started out as an assistant to Shin Morimura. He debuted in 2000 with Planetes, which was adapted to a 26-episode anime. He is currently working on Vinland Saga which began serialization in Weekly Shounen Magazine, and later on continued serialization in Afternoon.

He has won the 2009 Japan Media Arts Festival Grand Prize for Vinland Saga.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/1848968246)

Formerly from Madbox, currently employed at [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569/). Additionally, he serves as a Board member at [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569/).

[Website](https://www.yutakayamada.com/)

Yutaka Yamada is a Los Angeles-based music composer known for his work on the anime television series "Tokyo Ghoul", "VINLAND SAGA" and major Japanese films such as "Death Note:Light Up the New World", "BLEACH" and "KINDGOM". His masterpiece soundtracks for "Tokyo Ghoul" have gained worldwide popularity with related videos totaling over 70 million views on Youtube.

In 2018, Yamada composed for "Cry Me a Sad River", a Chinese film which had succeeded with USD $51Mil. In the same year, Eminem sampled Yamada's master piece "Glassy Sky (from "Tokyo Ghoul")" on his song "Good Guy" in his "Kamikaze" album. 
In 2019, he has worked alongside Sony Pictures for their mega-hit live-action film "KINGDOM" in which he received nomination for the 43rd Japan Academy Film Prize for Best Music Score. WIT Studio, famous for producing "Attack on Titan", released their most anticipated animation series "VINLAND SAGA", with an original soundtrack composed entirely by Yamada. 

Born in 1989, Yamada graduated from Senzoku Gakuen College of Music where he passionately studied musical composition. In 2009, he entered and won the first prize at VIENNA INSTRUMENTS Strings Arrangement Contest.

Today, he is represented by Soundtrack Music Associates, and has since relocated his production base from Tokyo to Sonic Fuel Studios in Los Angeles.

name.native: サバイブ・セッド・ザ・プロフェット

node.description:
[Website](https://survivesaidtheprophet.com) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/SSTPofficial) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/survivesaidtheprophet) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/survivesaidtheprophet) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/SSTPOFFICIAL)

__Biography__
Survive Said The Prophet commonly known as “SABAPURO” is formed in Tokyo, Japan in 2011. A native English speaker / bilingual vocalist, Yosh’s overwhelming singing ability and charisma at the head, it’s a miracle international rock band that consists of five talented, musicianship, and original characters. Their outstanding musicality is based on the wide background not limited to rock but also pop, electro, hip hop and R&B to place their field of activities in various fields using its diversity as a weapon that doesn’t fit in the frame of an existing scene and continues to evolve every day.

__Current Members__
- [Yoshiya Morita](https://anilist.co/staff/219035/Yosh) (Yosh) - vocal
- Tatsuya Kato - guitar
- [Ivan Kwong](https://anilist.co/staff/288633) - guitar
- Show Okada - drums

__Former Members__
- Takuya Suzuki - guitar (resigned in 2015)
- Kei Tatsuno - drums
- Yuki Hanazawa - support bassist, dirty vocal
- Yudai Kato - bass, scream (resigned in 2021)

(Sources: Survive Said the Prophet official website and Wikipedia)

[Website](http://www.aimer-web.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/aimer_and_staff) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/aimer_0907_official/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCR1zT1s524Hbc85bdvno_8w)

A Japanese pop singer and lyricist signed to SME Records and managed by FOURseam. Her name comes from the verb "aimer" in French which means "to love." She is known for being a faceless voice. She very rarely appears on her music videos and most of her live performances are dimly lit to obscure her face. She finally revealed herself on the August 20, 2016 episode of Music Station.

Her father was the bassist of a band, so Aimer grew up surrounded by music from a very young age. She began studying the piano in elementary school and highly looked up to Ringo Sheena and Utada Hikaru. In junior high school, listening to Avril Lavigne inspired her to take up guitar and began writing English lyrics. At the age of 15, Aimer lost her voice due to over-usage of her vocal cords and was forced to undergo silence therapy for treatment. However, that did not stop her, and after she recovered, she acquired her distinctive husky voice.

Aimer teamed up with the "Agehasprings" group, which has worked with, produced, or provided music for various artists, including Yuki, Mika Nakashima, Flumpool, Superfly, Yuzu, and Genki Rockets. In 2011, her musical career began in earnest. In May 2011, they released the concept album "Your Favorite Things." It covered numerous popular works, including works in various genre such as jazz and country western music.

Married [Masahiro Tobinai](https://anilist.co/staff/146979/Masahiro-Tobinai) in 2023.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/1848968246)

Formerly from Madbox, currently employed at [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569/). Additionally, he serves as a Board member at [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/1848968246)

Formerly from Madbox, currently employed at [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569/). Additionally, he serves as a Board member at [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569/).
_Note: Not to be confused with the [producer](https://anilist.co/staff/196154/)._
Shouji Hata is an Audio Engineer.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/42231474)

The founder and representative director of [Twin Engine](https://anilist.co/studio/6199/). Originally a producer for [Fuji TV](https://anilist.co/studio/169/), where he produced numerous anime for the Noitamina programming block.
